intro: Eriosema campestre, commonly known as the field eriosema, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has a fibrous root system that helps it thrive in well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Eriosema campestre is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
